UPDATE: At least 10 people have died with another 14 hospitalized, 9 of which have since been discharged, in a hotel fire that broke out on Saturday morning in Nanchang, Jiangxi province. 

Local authorities have confirmed 7 people related to the incident have been detained by police.

The fire has now been put out, with over 260 people evacuated from the building, according to local authorities.More than 10 workers were involved in a renovation project on the second floor of the hotel when the fire broke out. 

The 4-story hotel is connected to a 24-story apartment building.

A 9-year-old girl sells groceries and does homework while searching for her birth parents with a notice board telling her story in Dongguan, Guangdong Province.

The girl Maomao (alias) was raised by 70-year-old Huang Mengyi who found Maomao abandoned in front of her home in 2008, which she suspects was done by a neighboring couple. 

Huang adopted her and hasn't moved out from the old house hoping one day the little girl's parents would come back for her. Huang Mengyi felt sad while being interviewed, "I'm 70 years old and my physical condition is worsening every day. Who can take care of this small girl after I'm gone?" Huang said.

Haikou begins construction on quake-resistant sea bridge

At 5,666 meters long and 27 meters wide, this sea bridge will not open until 2019. Now under construction in Haikou, south China's Hainan province, the bridge will be built to withstand magnitude-8 earthquakes and strong typhoons. 

The bridge will also help serve a part of the region's power grid, electric railway, optical fiber, water and gas pipes. Amazing!

Tons of fish in great density gathered around the fishing boats "waiting" to be caught. Captain of one boat Xia Guoping has never experienced this kind of situation before during his 30-year career.

According to ocean experts, this area is where warm sea water from Yellow Sea met colder sea water from Taiwan that discomforted the living fish and made them float to the sea's surface.

status_message:
Meet the snow-busting tank!

Tuesday saw snow falling across many parts of north China, which inevitably means the painstaking task of clearing it away so we can all get on with our daily lives.

Baotou city in north China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region has revealed a new weapon in its snow clearing armoury - a tank-like vehicle, complete with caterpillar tracks and bogie wheels, but with a huge snow blower where the turret should be, reports YNET.com

"A jet engine is added on the tank chassis. Snow is blown away by the hot and high-speed air expelled by the engine", explain the designers at the China North Industries Group Corporation (CNIGC) which manufacture the machine.

On the road, it can reach speeds of 20 to 30 kilometres per hour, with the maximum speed being 48 to 50 kilometres an hour.

Off road, it can cope with severe environments, with the powerful jet of air able to clear away many obstacles it may encounter.

The snow-busting tank is not the only special vehicle the company makes - CNIGC also produces a firefighting tank!

status_message:
China is helping to renovate a major hospital in Myanmar's economic hub, Yangon.

The Bahan Women's Hospital, formerly named after Khin Kyi, Myanmar State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi's late mother, is a publicly-funded hospital.

At the groundbreaking ceremony held on Tuesday, Madame Wang Xuehong, the wife of the Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar, said Bahan Women's Hospital will be transformed into a fully equipped and functional obstetrics and gynecology hospital with outpatient and inpatient services, as well as delivery rooms and surgery rooms.

China will also provide training for doctors and nurses at the hospital. When the project is completed, Bahan Women's hospital will become the first China-Myanmar friendship hospital.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
66-year-old Chen Changfa has become a legend carrying a 2-meter-long food tray full of hot dishes with his head, serving local feasts for 38 years.

This technique has been passed down for 10 generations, since the middle of the Qing dynasty. The tray was designed to be 1 meter long and 20 cm wide in order to fit 10 dishes and allow the server to pass through a crowd of diners while carrying more dishes with both hands.

As time went by, Chen Changfa and his apprentice Yang Guangxiang are the only two left in town that still practice this tradition.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

China's popular bike-sharing app "Mobike" gets 300 million USD funding to expand overseas, the company's CEO Wang Xiaofeng announced on Monday.

Mobike received equity investment from Singapore's Temasek and add-on investment from Hillhouse Capital, which led Mobike's last round of funding.

Wang said Mobike will use the money to explore the global market by duplicating its business model elsewhere. He said the company will also spend more on research and development (R&D), manufacturing, and recruitment.

So just how does China Railway Corporation build a high-speed railway track?

A 580-ton mega machine sets girders into place and speeds up the whole construction process by carrying and setting one girder at a time.

China has over 12,500 miles of high-speed railway tracks, equally more than the combined total of the rest of the world. By 2025, China plans to reach up to 24,000 miles of high-speed railway tracks.

U.S. panda lovers are seizing the last opportunity to bid farewell to giant panda Bao Bao, who will leave for China next Tuesday from the Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C.

According to an agreement between the China Wildlife Conservation Association and the zoo, cubs born in the zoo to giant pandas on loan from China should be sent to China before they reach the age of 4.

Bao Bao is to be part of the breeding programs in China where she will learn Chinese, find a mate from a wide range of candidates and hopefully have cubs of her own.

Boeri's plan included Liuzhou, located in the mountainous region of northern Guangxi and Shijiazhuang, the capital of Hebei province that is known to suffer from heavy smog. The architect expects to see the first sustainable settlement of his in China by 2020.

Li grew up in an urban area and was once a millionaire in the 90s until she started to adopt abandoned children. Using her funds for the kids, she ran out of money by supporting them. 

Li now owes more than 2-million-yuan (300,000 USD) in debt, was diagnosed with cancer, yet she has never given up on caring for her 102 children.

Niangben gives Buddha a colorful new life with the spirit of the craftsman.
Niangben is the president of Regong Painting Institute in Tongren county, Qinghai province, and has been creating Thangka works for more than 20 years. Instead of repeating the work of early masters, Niangben relies on his own understanding of Buddhist scripture and painting skills he learned from traditional Chinese Gongbi painting.
He wants to give the old art form a colorful new life. Today, he trains orphans and children from poor families in his own painting academy for free. By teaching them Thangka, he hopes they can change their lives and inherit the Thangka art in the future.

China's last "cave village" is in Ziyun County, southwest China's Guizhou Province.

There are 19 families currently living in the village who are from ethnic group of Miao (Hmong). The cave of the village is 215 meters deep, 115 meters wide and 50 meters tall at an altitude of 1,800 meters. Research says the village is Asia's last tribe living in caves.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
International experts help Bagan to enlist as UNESCO World Heritage Site

Archaeologists from countries including China, India, Thailand, Germany, the U.S. and Japan are gathering in Bagan on Feb 15-16 to discuss the best solutions for restoring and preserving the hundreds of ancient monuments there.

At the opening of the conference, Chinese Ambassador to Myanmar Hong Liang announced new aid of 1 million US dollars to Bagan's monument reservation and conservation work. This comes as Myanmar gears up its effort to get Bagan on the UNESCO World Heritage list.

Situated in central Myanmar, Bagan is home to over 2,000 ancient pagodas, temples and monasteries with the oldest dating back to the 9th century, attracting hundreds of thousands of foreign tourists every year. But about one in five of these monuments were damaged by an earthquake that hit the region some six months ago. With the country about to enter the monsoon season in around three months, there comes a threat.

Myanmar's previous bid to put Bagan on UNESCO's World Heritage list in the 1990s was rejected due to poor management and the way the monuments had been conserved after the 1975 earthquake.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
One family has been the guardian of a 370-year-old tree for 16 generations.

The tree is an endangered species of Yew tree called Taxus chinensis that produces fruit that have some medical benefits, and is growing in Quzhou City, Zhejiang Province. 

As a rare tree species that is 2.5 million years old, villagers have been protecting the Taxus chinensis trees as a matter of tradition. Now this oldest tree has hundreds of thousands offspring planted nearby and also brought a few million yuan of income to the village.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
28-year-old Zhang Long displayed the "exosuit" he built by himself in Jilin City of northeast China's Jilin Province on Wednesday.

Zhang's goal is to assist blue-collar workers with extra strength to carry more heavy objects. This 10-kilogram metal suit was rebuilt based on a "simplified prototype" he made out of wood in last March that already helped him lift gas tanks.

The idea of an exoskeleton suit (exosuit) is the external skeleton that supports and protects a human body. An exosuit is usually powered by electric motors, hydraulics, or a combination of technologies that allow for limb movement with increased strength and endurance.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
Cliff village hopes for tourism boost after ladder safety improvements

An isolated village in Sichuan Province became the center of world attention last May because local students had to climb an 800-meter long rattan ladder secured to a sheer cliff face to get home from school. Now, the ladder has been replaced by a steel one, which students say saves them more than one hour in commuting.

Atule'er Village, home to 72 families and 15 students aged between six to 15, is known as a "cliff village" as it's located over 1,400 meters above sea level.

The rattan structure used in the past was roughly made by villagers out of rattan and bamboo and it didn't include any railings or other safety features, while the new one is reinforced with steel beams and has cost the village government one million yuan, or about $145,000 US dollars.

For students too young to climb the ladder, the village has started a preschool education class.

As poor road conditions have impeded economic development, the local government say they plan to develop tourism to alleviate poverty, attracting visitors to appreciate the natural resources of rivers and canyons and the cultural uniqueness of the lives of the indigenous Yi ethnic minority.

It's reported that the government has already signed contracts with tourism developers.

status_message:
"The One that's Gonna Get Away"

Washingtonians and staff at the Smithsonian's National Zoo bid farewell to giant panda Bao Bao, who will move to China on February 21st, 2017.

Bao Bao is the second surviving panda ever born in the National Zoo and have brought tremendous joy and happiness to the zoo-goers. Many giant panda fans are unwilling to let her go.

The four-year-old adolescent of a bear is said to be very independent and active. Unlike her kins who are widely known in China for their laid-back attitud, she is showing remarkable agility and really knows her way up and down a tree.

Bao Bao is to be part of the breeding programs in China where she will learn Chinese, find a mate from a wide range of candidates and hopefully have cubs of her own.

This video was shot on January 20th, 2017, when panda lovers have already started visiting the Zoo to say farewell.

Chinese President Xi Jinping has held phone talks with his US counterpart.

During the conversation, US President Donald Trump affirmed his commitment to the One-China policy, and said he attached importance to high-level exchanges between the two sides.

The Chinese leader said he appreciated the adherence to the One-China principle by the US government and again noted that it was the political basis for bilateral relations.

Xi Jinping also thanked Donald Trump for his Lantern Festival Greetings and praised President Trump's comments on the need for "constructive relations" between the two sides.

The US president, in an earlier letter, extended his greetings on the Year of Rooster to the Chinese leader and the people of China.

status_message:
One stream flows continuously throughout this winter, attracting tourists and photographers to the site. Located in eastern Inner Mongolia's Hinggan League, Arxan is usually covered in snow during the freezing winter.

As part of the Khalkh River (or Khalkhyn Gol), the ice-free stream is formed because of abundant geothermal energy generated by volcanic activity underneath the ground. The volcanic activity prevents the stream from freezing during the bitter winter; instead it often leaves a vapor visible on the surface due to the heat below.

Originating from the West Greater Hinggan Mountains, the Khalkh River eventually splits into two distributaries. It also marks the boundary between China and Mongolia.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

Sparks pour down as a molton iron art performer sprays burning hot iron at temperatures of around 1,000 degrees Celsius and water to simulate a fireworks display at a temple fair in Zhengzhou, capital city of Henan province, February 1, 2017. 

The performance, which dates back to China's Song Dynasty (960-1279), was held as a traditional way to celebrate the New Year, which also called Da Shuhua (Chinese for "tree flower) the tradition involves experienced blacksmiths showering themselves with molten iron.

In ancient China, the rich would always celebrate New Year with fire crackers, but poor blacksmiths could not afford them, so they had to rely on their to find a cheaper alternative, becoming the origin of molton iron art.

status_message:
Mexican authorities announced Wednesday that Chinese automaker JAC would soon begin producing cars in the central Mexican state of Hidalgo.

Hidalgo Governor Omar Fayad announced the 4.4-billion-peso (212-million-U.S.-dollar) deal between Mexico's Giant Motors Latinoamerica and Chinese state-owned automaker JAC Motors at a press conference in the capital.

Under the deal, Mexico will begin assembling Chinese cars in March at a plant in Ciudad Sahagun, about 60 km northeast of Mexico City and the first cars are expected to roll off assembly lines in the second half of this year.

Mexico's Minister of Economy Ildefonso Guajardo said that the deal came at a time when the country is trying to diversify its sources of foreign investment amid uncertainty over its future ties with the United States.

status_message: Seasonal change is an important part of Chinese culture and as the Spring Festival heralds in the Lunar New Year, watch a dancer move through the seasons in China.

Ivanka Trump joins Washingtonians to celebrate China Culture Evening.

On Wednesday night, hundreds of guests attended the China Culture Evening at the Chinese Embassy in the United States in Washington DC, among the guests were Ivanka Trump and her mandarin-speaking daughter Arabella.

Paper-cutting, dough figurine, sugar painting and much more, this annual Night-at-the-Embassy installment featured as many cultural elements as a modest museum, but no museum in the DC area comes even close in the offering of good food.

And we are not even talking about the dumplings and shrimps that the guests enjoyed at the buffet. As a matter of fact, many of the items on exhibit were edible, but the devil is in finding out which. For instance, the tiny yellow rooster dough figurine held in Arabella's hand, that could be edible. And yes, it is vegetarian.

The Wednesday event was jointly hosted by the Chinese Embassy to the United States and the Meridian International Center, the latter had put in years of efforts to promote people-to-people exchanges between China and the U.S.

Chinese Ambassador Cui Tiankai took the occasion to call for cooperation between China and the US in the face of difficulties and challenges:

"Over these decades, we have learned that we should always respond to difficulties and challenges by cooperation, instead of conflict or confrontation; that we should fully respect concerns of each other and never challenge the core interest of the other side; and that we should work together for win-win cooperation, instead of being misguided by zero-sum or cold war mentality."

Wednesday marks the fifth of a 15-day New Year celebration on the Chinese lunar calendar, at the end of which is the Lantern Festival on February 11 this year.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

Wardrobe murder suspect has been returned to Hong Kong!

Police in Guangdong Province has handed over a suspect in a murder case to Hong Kong police at the request of the special administrative region.

The case dates back to December 2013 when a 26-year-old Dragonair flight attendant was murdered and later found in the bedroom wardrobe of her apartment.

The victim's former boyfriend Mo Chun-hsien was identified as the suspect after an investigation.

Mo fled Hong Kong to the mainland after the murder.

The suspect was eventually arrested in Shenzhen in October last year.

Official figures show Guangdong police have sent 174 suspects back to Hong Kong since 2000.

status_message:
Zebra attacks zookeeper during feeding in southern China!

Several days after a man was mauled by a tiger in eastern China, a video has emerged on Weibo showing a zebra attacking its keeper.

The incident happened at the Chimelong Safari Park in southern China's Guangzhou. The zebra is seen in the video biting the male zookeeper and pulling him for several meters. The man's three colleagues chase the zebra, trying to free the man.

According to the video, the attack happened on Tuesday. But a statement from the Park said the incident happened in December. The zookeeper who was attacked has been identified as Li Chun. He received a minor injury to his hand and has since returned to work.

The zebra is said to have calmed down on its own, after a period of time.

Chun was apparently guiding the zebra to its room when it became angry and bit his left hand, according to reports.

Chinese Ambassador to the United States Cui Tiankai calls for continued cooperation between China and the United States as the world observes in uncertainty the transition of power in Washington DC.

"China loves peace and safeguards peace. We object to any and all attempts to sabotage world peace and stability. China seeks win-win cooperation in the international community and rejects self-enrichment at the cost of others. China is open to the world and is willing to make greater contribution to the common welfare of humanity, but will never condone infringement upon its national sovereignty and territorial integrity. We do not make trouble but we have no fear of trouble. We pursue friendship and cooperation, but balk not in face of threats and provocations. Through blood and sacrifice, the Chinese people fought hard for liberation and strove relentlessly for prosperity. And with the same tenacity we will achieve national rejuvenation in spite of all obstacles. Where there is a will, there is a way. We are certain to create a better tomorrow."

Cui Tiankai says China and US can not and should not stray from the path of cooperation. Both members of the UN Security Council now constitute the two largest economies in the world, and therefore it behooves them to cooperate to the benefit of both their peoples and that of the international community.

Cui's comments come just a few days after the inauguration of Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, who after winning in the general election had made some high-profile remarks about China that some fear could lead to a trade war.

However, Cui Tiankai suggests China and US should work together to create a powerful boost for the recovery of the world economy, instead of fighting a trade war that benefits none but hurts the world economy at large.

Cui also addressed the misconception about rule-making in international trade, saying the rules are not dictated either by the US or by China but instead must be created and observed by various countries in the world together.

Cui says China looks forward to continuing and improving the communication mechanisms between Beijing and Washington DC once the Trump administration moves beyond the transition period.

The Chinese Ambassador made those remarks after a Wednesday reception held at the Embassy which hundreds of overseas Chinese attended. The reception was held to mark the Chinese New Year that falls on January 28th.
It's been a massive year for us here at China Plus News! To all our followers, thanks for sharing it with us! Happy Chinese New Year!

Twenty-three giant panda cubs posed for a Chinese New Year greeting Friday at a breeding base in Chengdu city in southwest China's Sichuan Province. 

The 23 panda cubs were all born in Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding in 2016. 

The cubs, each held by their own keeper, posed in front of cameras to send to the world their greetings for the Lunar New Year. 

According to Wu Kongju, head of the management department of the breeding base, the panda cubs were born between May and August last year. They all grew fast and the weight of the heaviest is 12 kilograms. 

Today's show is not the cubes' debut. 

Earlier this month, their collective photo has been selected as "best picture of the year 2016" by media outlets including Reuters, Time, and The Atlantic Monthly. 

The picture, taken when the cubs were placed on a stage when meeting the public for the first time last September, features one naughty cub falling face-first off and the keeper hastily walking to it for a belated rescue, while all rest pandas lay on stage lazily and knew nothing about the "accident".

The cub wasn't hurt as the stage was short.

This year marks the 30th anniversary of the breeding base. Since its founding, it has bred 243 giant panda cubs, with 176 surviving.
link_name: "Star" panda babies say hi to the world

status_message:
China's human rights progress held at UN headquarters -- Photo exhibition on the progress on rights of ethnic minorities. 

The rights of ethnic minority groups to develop their economy has been recognized in China. 

Between 2012 and 2015, the central government arranged an ethnic minority development fund of 14.8 billion yuan, in exclusive support of the actions to enrich border areas and their residents, efforts to develop ethnic minorities with a relatively small population, efforts to promote ethnic minority-style villages and stockade villages, and efforts to preserve and develop ethnic minorities' traditional handicrafts. 

The state appropriated 5.8 billion yuan from the central budget to help the construction of infrastructure, improvement of production and living conditions of the general population and the development of social undertakings in border regions and areas inhabited by people of ethnic minorities with a comparatively small population.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

During the summit, China stated its opinions on women-related issues and made an important promise to enhance gender equality and improve women's statuses.

status_message:
A firefighter in Shanghai was recently seen running with a burning gas tank to a river 200 meters away before throwing it into the water, just in time to avoid any further calamity.

The incident began after a resident forgot to turn off the stove after cooking and the gas cylinder caught on fire. The firefighters first evacuated all neighbors when they arrived at the scene. However, the attempts to shut off the gas tank all failed due to a broken valve. 

Knowing that a devastating explosion could happen at any time, the firefighters quickly decided to take the gas tank out of the building by hand and throw it into the river nearby. Thankfully, they were successful.

China's first freight train to Britain arrived in London on Wednesday.

Departing from Yiwu West Railway Station in eastern Zhejiang Province, the train traveled for about 18 days over a distance of more than 12,000 kilometers before reaching its destination in Britain.

Yiwu, known for producing small commodities, was mainly carrying items such as household goods, clothing, cloth, bags and suitcases.

On its journey it passed through Kazakhstan, Russia, Belarus, Poland, Germany, Belgium and France before arriving in east London.

The British capital is the 15th city in Europe to be added to China-Europe freight train services.

The service will improve China-Britain trade ties, strengthen connectivity with western Europe, while better 
serving China's Belt and Road Initiative, an infrastructure and trade network connecting 60 countries in Asia, 
Europe, the Middle East and Africa along ancient trade routes.
link_name: China's first freight train to Britain arrived in London

Massive crowds were seen on the first Spring Festival travel rush in Wuhan.

Thousands of passengers wait for trains at Hankou Railway Station in Wuhan, Hubei Province on Jan. 13, 2017, the first day of the 40-day-long Spring Festival travel rush. 

About 2.98 billion trips are expected during the travel rush period, with more than 24 million passengers expected to depart from Wuhan alone, a 9 percent increase over last year. 

The travel rush, also known as Chunyun, begins on Jan. 13 and lasts until Feb. 21. Spring Festival is the country's most important holiday, with hundreds of millions of people returning home for family reunions, putting huge stress on the nation's transportation systems.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

China's aircraft carrier Liaoning, joined by several destroyers and J-15 fighter jets returned to Qingdao port on Friday, Jan. 13, 2017 after finishing a blue-water drill in West Pacific. 

The fleet sailed through the Bohai Sea, the Yellow Sea, the East China Sea and the South China sea. It also passed through the Miyakato, Bashi and Taiwan straits, according to the People's Liberation Army Navy (PLAN). 

During the training, the J-15 fighter jets also carried out a series of drills including takeoffs and landings, air interceptions and aerial refueling.  

The high-seas drill indicated that the aircraft carrier Liaoning and its carrier strike group have obtained combat capability. Future drills of Liaoning will be determined by actual situations, said PLAN.

Sometimes tigers need be creative to warm up during the cold winter days. 

A Bengal tiger from a local safari park in Chongqing has gone viral as it seemed try to warm up by "hugging" a car, trying to soak up the warmth from the car's engine.

The visitors inside the vehicle apparently were stunned, even scared by the act, but the tiger seemed uninterested in the car's passengers. Instead it leaned on the hood of the car and gazed at them through the windshield. 

There is a gentle expression rather than hostile look in the tiger's eyes, as it seemed to do what a house cat would do, sitting on a TV or heater to get warm. 

Much to our benefit, the passenger in the front seat was able to remain calm enough to capture the rare sight with his phone before the tiger was finally shooed away by the staff.

status_message:
In embarrassing moment for parent, child brings dead fish to class for observation

A picture showing a boy with a large dead fish on his desk has attracted some attention on Chinese social media in recent days.

The boy took a large dead carp to his kindergarten class following an assignment to bring a fish to observe in class. Meanwhile, his classmates seemed to have made better choices, with either a small gold fish or a turtle that is still alive. 

The boy's father explained that "the case accidentally happened. I didn't intend to give him the dead fish. Actually my kid didn't deliver his teacher's instructions clearly and said any type of fish would do. Then I picked one from the carp I caught. Carp is not tasty, so I gave it to him." 

Many netizens have chimed in after the photo was posted publicly. While many people only regarded it as a funny incident, some said that carp is also considered a type of fish, so no one is to blame. Others have pointed fingers at the boy's father for his carelessness.

status_message:
A water channel built along cliffs and spanning three mountains, stretching more than seven kilometers, has been bringing water for drinking and irrigation to Zunyi city, Guizhou province since it was completed in 1995.

The project was led by Huang Dafa, now 82-years-old, and hundreds of his fellow villagers helped to dig the 7,200-meter trench.

Huang says the work was not easy, but he and his 200 neighbors never gave up. They spent three years building the water channel, knowing it would improve their lives, and living conditions in their remote village in southwestern China. They had only simple tools at their disposal.

Thanks to the channel, the yield of foxtail millet in the village has risen tremendously in the last 20 years. The annual yield has increased from 30 thousand kilogram to 500 thousand kilogram.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
NASA releases Beijing smog satellite Images of 14 years. 

A series of images released by NASA shows the massive expanse of smog in Beijing from space over a period of 14 years. 

Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) on NASA's Aqua satellite acquired these natural-color images in a period from 2002 to 2016. 

According to NASA, many of the particles in the haze "are sulfate aerosols produced by burning coal". Residents in northern China widely use coal to heat homes in the winter, even if local governments have taken measures to encourage locals to use clean energy such as electricity and gas instead of coal. Tap on the photos to learn more.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

Train travel over the New Year holiday surges in China 

To accommodate all of the tourists over the new year holiday, China Railway Corporation (CRC) dispatched 187 additional trains to accommodate the travel rush during the last day of the three-day New Year holiday yesterday. 

About 7.45 million train trips were made Sunday, the second day of the holiday, surging 11.3 percent year on year, the CRC said.

There were an expected 9.58 million trips on Monday, the last day of the holiday, according to the CRC.

status_message:
Beijing will extend the orange alert for heavy air pollution for another three days as heavy smog will continue in the city, environmental authorities said Monday.

The alert, which was originally effective from Friday to Sunday, will not be lifted until Wednesday midnight, according to a statement issued by the Beijing Municipal Environmental Protection Bureau.

Air quality will improve Monday because of weak cold air, but will return to the medium or heavy air pollution level on Tuesday and Wednesday, the statement said.

Under the emergency plan, heavy polluting gasoline-fuelled vehicles and trucks carrying construction garbage are banned from roads. Some manufacturing firms are required to cut production.

Beijing has a four-tier alert system for pollution, with red the highest, followed by orange, yellow and blue. The orange alert means the air quality index is forecast to exceed 200 for three consecutive days.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
Chinese student defends himself in armed robbery in U.S. 

When three men broke into his apartment in U.S., Zhang, a Chinese student shot at them. The incident went loose within Chinese social media.

The incident occurred early December, when Zhang was studying in the dining room and three men, at least one understood to be armed, came into his apartment. Zhang fired a shot at the men and called the police. The men fled.

A few weeks later a body was found, the police confirmed that this was the man Zhang shot at and he died as he was escaping the apartment.

Zhang was studying at University of Michigan, admitted to being a gun enthusiast and said he had bought several guns in the USA, including a Hawk 981.

This was not the first robbery Zhang had experienced in his apartment. When Zhang was moving into the apartment this year, the luggage of his roommate was stolen. The couple of months later his car was stolen with his driving license. 

Zhang mentioned that Chinese living in U.S. would be sometimes robbed or treated unfairly. Usually they would be quiet about such situations and not make a fuss, but Zhang hopes more Chinese will stand up for themselves.
link_name: Photos from China Plus News's post

status_message:
Leading scientists have identified how a major smog component, known as sulfate, forms during haze in northern China. 

In a study published by the US journal Science Advances, reactive nitrogen and water particles in the air are described as the two missing pieces, suggesting that reducing nitrogen oxide (NOx) emission may help curb China's air pollution.

The findings were based on an analysis of the January 2013 winter haze in Beijing, one of the worst atmospheric pollution events ever recorded in China. The daily concentration of fine particle known as PM2.5 exceeds the World Health Organization guideline value by 16 times.

A song of 'Xianshui,' a traditional Dan song about lives of people in a fishering village by the 77-year-old Yang Aixiang from Puqian, a small town by the seaside in China's Hainan province. As one of the "Dan People", her family would lived off fishing for decades.

China launched a carbon dioxide monitoring satellite, which will help understanding of climate change at 3:22 a.m. Thursday.

The satellite via a Long March-2D rocket  was launched from Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in northwest China's Gobi Desert.

The satellite will also provide China's policy makers with independent data.

China is the third country after Japan and the United States to monitor greenhouse gases through its own satellite.

The 620-kg satellite TanSat was sent into a sun synchronous orbit about 700 kilometers above the earth and will monitor the concentration, distribution and flow of carbon dioxide (CO2) in the atmosphere.
link_name: China launches satellite to monitor global carbon emissions

An angry sanitation worker in Hefei, east China's Anhui Province encircled an SUV in trash bins, attempting to teach the owner a lesson about illegal intersection parking.  

The intersection makes part of a garbage station and fire channel. The sanitation worker said he decided to detain the car after several failed attempts to reach the owner of the vehicle.  [Source: pearvideo.com]

Random acts of kindness! A bus driver stopped to help an elderly passenger off his bus in Guangzhou, south China's Guangdong Province.

As the bus arrived at the stop, the driver noticed an elderly passenger standing at the door waiting.  When the driver noticed he was unable to disembark without aid, the driver personally walked to the back door and helped him off!
link_name: A driver helps an old man get off a bus

The Chinese Navy recently conducted the first live-fire aircraft carrier battle group in the Bohai Sea, the People's Liberation Army Navy said on Thursday.

In formation with several destroyers and frigates, the Liaoning carried out training in reconnaissance and early warning systems, air interception, sea assault, air-defense and anti-missile exercises.

Carrying live ammunition, several batches of J-15 carrier-based aircraft had performed strike exercises.
The drill, part of the aircraft carrier's overall test and trial, examined weaponry functions and training quality, according to the naval sources.
link_name: Chinese navy holds live-fire drill for aircraft carrier formation

status_message:
A bus trailing plumes of thick white smoke from its back was spotted driving on a highway in east China's Jiangsu Province on Dec. 4, 2016. Luckily no passengers were on board at that time.

According to traffic police who stopped the bus later, the bus was heading to Zhenjiang when heavy smoke was seen pouring out from the back of the bus, filling the sky. The driver reportedly found the dangerous situation immediately, but instead of pulling over, he continued driving for more than 20 kilometers until he arrived at his destination.

The preliminary investigation showed the supercharger of the bus caught fire and triggered the smoke. The driver was fined 200 yuan for driving vehicles with a potential safety hazard, even though no casualties were involved in the incident.
link_name: Why did a bus, engulfed in thick smoke, refuse to stop?

A man in Wuxi, east China's Jiangsu Province is being hailed as a hero after risking his life to take a burning gas tank out of his neighbor's home. The man said he felt everything was worth it as long as the neighbor is safe, even if he was blown up.

63-year-old Cai Dingfeng, arrived back home when he saw flames coming out of his neighbor's kitchen.
The neighbor surnamed Wang was reportedly cooking when the gas pipe leaked and triggered a fire. Wang freaked out and was burned badly.

Cai immediately wrapped his hand with a wet cloth and dragged the burning gas tank out to a safe place. The whole ordeal only took about 4 minutes.
link_name: Hero said, "saving another's life is worth it, even if it mean...

status_message: Kunqu , also known as Kunju , Kun opera or Kunqu Opera, is one of the oldest extant forms of Chinese opera. It evolved from the Kunshan melody, and dominated Chinese theatre from the 16th to the 18th centuries. It is listed as one of the Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO since 2001. Clip the video to learn more about the main roles in Chinese Kunqu Opera! Lion dancing is a tradition in Chinese culture that spans through a number of other Asian countries. The performers dance in a lion suit, they usually perform during Chinese New Year along with other Chinese festivals.

The Xihu Lion Dancing is a type of lion dancing in Songkou Town, Southeast China's Fujian Province. People here believe that the lion dancing will bring them guidance and safety.
Freezing ice takes its toll? These kids in northeast China just hold on and slide!

Bowing is an important wedding ritual throughout China. Here a wedding in Songkou Town shows a ritual of three bows. The bride will visit the grooms house, and as soon as she arrives, the couple bow. The first bow is to Heaven and Earth, the second to the parents, and the third to their spouse.

The ancient town of Songkou has a history of over 1,000 years, and has 160 protected residential bulidings. It is in Yongtai county of Fuzhou, Fujian province.

My Encounter With Chinese Folk Melody (Episode 3): Recall From Shaanxi

As a part of the Second 'Maritime Silk Road' (Fuzhou) International Tourism Festival, Shaolin monks from the Southern Shaolin Monastery have performed Shaolin Kung Fu for all the visitors from different countries. 

While the northern Shaolin temple is the birthplace of Kungfu, it is the southern Kung Fu style that Jet Li trained in, focusing more on fighting with arms.

Investigations into live streaming after misleading behaviour from content creators have been opened by local police and administration of Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture.
 
A video released online show two men live streaming as they distribute money to villagers in one of the poorest counties in Liangshan Prefecture. After they shot the video, however, they took the money back from the villagers.
 
The plot thickens, however, as one of the two men in the video above is famous for revealing such deceit from other live streaming creators. In this instance, the other competitors secretly recorded what he did after live streaming to catch him out.
 
The catch is that live streaming creators can earn money through the service, as the audience sends them gifts. Providing sensationalised content can draw in more followers. The man in question has over 600,000 followers and later admitted his behavior was an attempt to get more views and followers.
link_name: Investigations into live streaming after misleading behavior

status_message:
China has successfully launched its largest carrier rocket, the Long March-5, in south China on Thursday night.

The launch of the rocket marks a new step forward under China's space plans, which include probes on the Moon and Mars, as well as building its own manned space station.

The rocket is 50 percent larger than other members in the Long March rocket family, while its carrying capacity is 2.5 times of those of others.

The rocket arrived at the Wenchang launch center in south China's Hainan Province in September for final assembly and testing.
link_name: China successfully launches its largest carrier rocket

status_message: The 2016 Airshow China gave a peak at some of China's coolest and hottest rockets and ships in outer space.

North Korea: An awareness meeting by the IFRC was held in Beijing trying to raise funds for the thousands of North Koreans that were displaced by a typhoon, leaving them homeless and facing a cold winter with little food and supplies.

More than 130 people died and another 400 went missing in August due to Typhoon Lionrock, according to public figures, with 30,000 homes destroyed to varying degrees.

North Korean authorities have launched a major reconstruction effort, but have asked international humanitarian organisations for help. Footage from a trip by Red Cross officials to Musan in North Hamgyong showed people living in temporary shelters amid rubble and mud-caked areas of destruction left in the wake of the flooding.

"It's a 15.4 million dollar emergency appeal, intended to support about 300,000 people over the period of a year, but we are having to reduce the scope of our programmes, simply because at the moment we've only got 3.8 million." said Patrick Fuller, Asia Pacific communications manager for the IFRC.
link_name: North Koreans facing winter homeless because of floods

status_message:
A group of people in Shanghai are being hailed as heroes after saving an elderly man who was ran over by a car. 

Video camera shows the elderly man stopped his bike at a cross to wait for the traffic light in Qingpu district and apparently didn't notice a van besides him, which was about to backing up. The van then brought down the man and ran over him.  

More than 10 locals passing by at that moment immediately came to the van. While some lifted the car up, the others pulled the injured man out from underneath the van, taking less than one minute. 

The 64-year-old man was then rushed to the hospital and was out of danger. But he was severely injured, with several fractures. 

According to traffic police, the female driver of the van didn't check before backing up. The elderly man, however, should have also waited behind the stopping line for the green light instead of stopping on the crossing. The accident is under further investigation.
link_name: Good Samaritans save elderly man run over by van

On Thursday, a man sneaked into a giant panda house in Nanchang Zoo, Jiangxi Province and ended up in a very sticky situation.

The visitor was allegedly showing off to his female friends, so he jumped into the panda house and teased a sleeping panda which were all caught by the surveillance camera.

The footage shows the panda woke up and griped the man's leg at first, which is amusing, but quickly turns into panic when the panda wrestled the man onto the ground.

The man struggled to escape but failed several time for the strong grip.

Then the 12-year-old male panda, Meiling, pressed itself upon the man before he barely escaped and fleeing the wrestle.

The man was later given a medically assessment but amazingly escaped unharmed.

Zoo authority once again made it clear to all visitors that although giant pandas look cute, they can be very aggressive.

The video has gone viral in the past few days on Chinese social media websites and many users said the man should be punished for his inappropriate act.

Why have 2 children? China's new 2-child policy

A recent study found only 18% of the 11 million qualified couples have applied to have a 2nd baby since 2013 when China loosened its decades-long one-child policy, opening to everyone in 2016.

The culture has changed- kids are expensive and take time, and 1 child is the new normal in China. Here is one woman's reason for having a second child.

China has 55 minority groups, one of them being the Dai minority group mostly living in south China's Yunnan province.

In April every year, they have dragon boat races, a giant water fight, a lantern festival, and visit Buddhist temples. Check it out in this episode of China From Above. New episodes every week!

On Wednesday, a worker driving a sanitation vehicle nearly ran over a dog in Suzhou, east China's Jiangsu Province. The dog owner was angry with the worker and beat him. The worker tried to fight back, but he finally failed and was seriously injured. 

The worker was then sent to hospital, while the dog owner was detained for seven days. The incident has aroused a public sense of respect for the men and women who keep their cities clean and tidy.
link_name: Cleaner beaten by a dog owner

A heavy snow on Tuesday at Yabuli National Forest Park in Harbin city has excited You You, a 9-year-old panda, as he rolls joyfully in the snow.

The panda was recently moved from Sichuan province that has mild temperatures to Harbin in northeast China's Heilongjiang Province. Normally, You You is quiet and sluggish, what he likes most is sleeping, but with the snow he became playfully lively. Welcome to your new home, You You!

Robots helping children and the elderly:

iPal is a robot now on the market that can help babysit your children. Selling for around 10,000 RMB (US $1,500), the robots are capable of updating the answers to deal with questions from the children and providing the latest education programs.

Meridian Network Corporation started as a medical company and first self-designed robot "Little Angel" is still in the testing phase and has not been launched in the market. Little Angel can use data to design a personal health plan and also help the elderly with a limited range of medical tests and contacting doctors online.The product market director, Brain Zhai says voice integration is a problem they're still dealing with.

The World Robots Conference in Beijing ran from Oct. 20-25, 2016 supported by the Chinese government, showing off the latest robot technology.
link_name: Robots helping children and the elderly

China Radio International (CRI) is celebrating 75 years! So celebrate with us!

Chinese Red, or the bright bold red color so commonly associated with China, means festive, joyous, and lucky! We want to see your Chinese Red in your city, your home, your life, or your festivities in photos or video!

We have some exclusive prizes from CRI to give away, to claim them, just message us on Facebook with:

2. Don't forget to include details about yourself - where you are from, your name, and how you heard about us by November 27, 2016.

A group of border soldiers in Shantou, southern China are being hailed as heroes after saving a fisherman from his boat as it was about to sink. 

Video camera footage shows the frightened fisherman asking for help as his boat was foundering on a reef off Shantou on Friday afternoon, due to deadly Typhoon Haima. 

The border soldiers who subsequently arrived tried to rescue the man, but were beaten back by the storm. The fishing boat was listing badly, with only a small part of it visible on surface. 

The heroes devised another rescue plan, lifting the trapped fisherman off of the sinking vessel using a crane.
link_name: Fisherman rescued after boat dashed onto rocks

status_message:
Onlookers gasped when a sika deer flew through a street in downtown Shanghai. The deer is believed to have run away from a nearby farm or private property. 

The escaped deer galloped down the street and ran into a residential building. 

Thankfully experts arrived later and tranquillized the deer so it could be safely transported. 

Experts also warned that while the sika deer is usually a tame animal, it can become dangerous when in heat. 
Sika deer are under the first-class national protection in China.
link_name: Sika deer escapes in Shanghai streets

Anger issues: Woman is violently punched in elevator in front of her kid after asking a man to stop smoking

A video circulating on Chinese social media recently has triggered massive outrage. In the surveillance camera footage, a man was seen beating a woman repeatedly in an elevator, while the victim's kid was right beside her, crying. The incident took place on October 12, 2016, in Langfang, central China's Hebei province.

As the man fled, the woman called the police. The woman, surnamed Li, told the police that she asked the man to stop smoking in the elevator for the sake of the child. The man then started thrashing her. 

"Ever since I was born, I have never seen such savage and inhumane thug," said Ms. Li.
Local police are still hunting the man.

Innovation highlighted at the World Robot Conference 2016 in Beijing

With a national 10-year plan called "Made in China 2025" and the "Robotics Industry Development Plan (2016-2020)", China is aiming to become one of the leading technological industrial nations within just a few years. 

In recent years, the Chinese government has been supporting innovation through start-ups.

Two pandas born in captivity, the 3-year-old Hua Yan and 2-year-old Zhang Meng, were released into the wild at Liziping Nature Reserve, southwest China's Sichuan Province on Thursday morning. 

They have become the 6th and 7th giant pandas bred in captivity to be released into the wild.

Before they were released, the two have gone through various training lessons, such as how to find food and avoid predators.

Panda conservationists in China hope to raise the population of wild panda bears to between 2,000 and 2,200 by the year 2025.

The silkworms, as part of an experiment designed by a Hong Kong middle school student, will live with the astronauts for the next month. They will be tested for growth and development in space.

Have a headache due to smog? Here is a solution!

A smog-eating tower, designed by Dutch artist Daan Roosegaarde, has come to Beijing. 

The tower contains an air-purifying machine that catches PM 2.5 particles, the main component of smog and then "exhales" air that is 75% cleaner. Particles collected by the tower are then turned into beautiful rings, helping to fund the building of new smog free towers. 

The tower has started running in Beijing, one week ahead of its formal unveiling.

Modern Kazakh Horse Whisperers in Xinjiang, China

For centuries, Kazakhs have kept the tradition of herding and wild horse taming, even until now in modern times. 

Muratbek Kykysha, a horse trainer and a herder is seen in the video taming a horse. The 28-year-old is a staff member of the Golden Triangle Cattle and Sheep Cooperative in Altay Prefecture of Xinjiang. 

The 118,000-square-meter area hosts only 640,000 residents, with half of them belong to China's Kazakh ethnic minority.

27 people are missing, several houses collapsed following a landslide on Wednesday afternoon triggered by heavy downpours brought on by Typhoon Megi in Sucun Village, east China's Zhejiang province. 

A video captured the moment when the landslide swept away several houses built at the foot of a hill. 
Rescuers have arrived at the site to search for survivors. 

Also affected by the typhoon, another six people in Baofeng Village of Wencheng County went missing on Wednesday night after their homes had been destroyed by a landslide.

Video footage also showed the turbulent flood waters sweeping through Wencheng County.
link_name: 26 missing, houses collapsed in landslide in east China

status_message:
World's longest cross-sea bridge connects

Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge (HZMB) is scheduled to be connected today, making it the world's longest cross-sea bridge.

HZMB has a total length of about 55 km, including a 6.7 km underwater tunnel and a 23-km bridge over the sea.

The project is part of the country's planned national highway network, linking the western and eastern banks of the Pearl River. It is to meet the demand of passenger and freight transport among Hong Kong, mainland and Macao.

A kitten was found caught inside a pipe in Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region. 

Rescuers arrived on site and successfully rescued the cat. 

The poor kitten ran away immediately after being saved.

Housing bubble? Footage has gone viral online at a new housing development in east China's Hangzhou showing a crowd rushing to buy up real estate. 

Why?

The spree was prompted by the new restrictions on Monday which prevent people born outside Hangzhou from buying more than 1 property in a move to try and cool the real estate market, which reportedly has had rapid price increases in recent months.

Apparently, the move may have backfired, as all properties at this development were reportedly purchased within hours of this video footage.

Guess what this is - a Torpedo? No! It is the new underwater glider independently developed by China. The glider in the video is the real thing, not a model! The 1.8-meter-long submergable vessel is called the Petrel Glider – Hai Yan. It is designed to work at depths of up to 1500 meters deep in the sea, and can travel distances as far as 1,000 km.

Scooter attacker admits "bad mood" after kicking a woman over hard enough that she remains in the hospital in a coma.

The night of Sept. 15 in Guangxi, this unlucky woman was the victim of Zhuo Pinghai, a man living at a construction site that admits after drinking alcohol he wanted to blow off some steam, kicking over the woman in an unprovoked attack.

The woman remains unconscious in hospital with life-threatening injuries. The case is still under investigation.
link_name: Road rage in an unprovoked attack

status_message:
Need a ride? Get on this wooden bull!

A 66-year-old carpenter from a local village in Jilin, northeastern China has created this moving wooden bull. With a small pull, the bull can move automatically with no motor, showing the beauty of engineering from ancient times, dating back to the period of the Three Kingdoms (220 - 280 AD).

The big wooden bull is prized as it can transport 5 people at one time. It also can pull heavy goods weighing more than 250 kg while carrying one person at the same time.

Students skip rope at Red Army Elementary School, located at the foot of Loushanguan mountain, or Loushan Pass.

Students are familiar with the stories and legends of the Long March, especially those that took place in Loushanguan, and are inspired to study hard by the Long March spirits.

There are some 200 students studying in this elementary school in the village.
link_name: Red Army Elementary School in Guizhou

status_message: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang arrived in Ottawa for an official visit.
Pro-Wrestling in China, what's the deal?
New gear is being used in a surprise way! At a local music show "Qian Hui Xi Yu", or "traveling back to the Western Regions" in China's Xinjiang, dancers glide through the audience on hover boards.
link_name: Dancer with hover board on stage

status_message:
Young soldiers on parade! Freshmen from Tsinghua University in Beijing present their military training results! 
The training is required for University freshmen across China, aiming to promote team spirit.

Still remember the touching environmental documentary "Oceans" and "Winged Migration"? 

Their director Jacques Perrin is going to take his latest masterpiece "The Seasons" to China at the opening of the 3rd Franco-Chinese Month of the Environment on Sept 27th.

Both an ecological fable and a veiled critique of contemporary economic development, this documentary retraces the natural history of Europe from the end of the ice age until the present. Following the director's previous two films, "The Seasons" is filled with images that take the breath away.

Organized by the French embassy in China, this year's Franco-Chinese Month of the Environment will focus on the theme of "Biodiversity". 

The event will run until October 27.

New York City Mayor Bill De Blasio said Saturday that there is "no evidence at this point of a terror connection" to an explosion in New York Saturday evening, in which twenty-nine people were injured.

The mayor made the remarks at a news conference Saturday night, saying the real cause of the explosion is still under investigation.

Authorities said police are investigating the blast as a criminal act not immediately linked to any terror organization.

Twenty-nine people were injured in the explosion in the Chelsea neighborhood in New York on Saturday evening.

The incident occurred just three days before the opening of 71st Session of the UN General Assembly in the UN Headquarters in New York. The host city of the world body is already on high alert to guarantee the security of visiting heads of state or government.
link_name: No evidence of terror attack: New York City mayor

status_message: Artists in Hong Kong are using a new technology called "Air Ink" that turns polluted air into black ink paint markers. Graviky Labs partnered with Tiger Beer to turn pollution into ink that makes beautiful art.
Over the years, Tibetan men have walked thousands of miles to collect salt. They sing to appreciate the generosity of Nature, and to express their homesickenss. This is one of them.

status_message:
An 800-year-old bridge collapsed in turbulent flood waters that were triggered by super typhoon Meranti on September 15, 2016.

The super typhoon landed in Fujian early Thursday morning, bringing strong winds and heavy rainstorms to the region.

The super typhoon is reportedly to be the strongest of its kind in the world so far this year, with gales of up to 48 meters per second. Local meteorological authorities also reported the typhoon to be the strongest one hitting southern Fujian since 1949.
link_name: 800-year-old bridge collapsed after super typhoon Meranti hit ...

status_message:
Before Super Typhoon Meranti hit Fujian, moon decided to run away!

A model moon was spotted rolling across downtown streets of Fuzhou, in southeast China's Fujian Province on September 14, 2016. 

The Super Typhoon was expected to hit Fujian on earlier Thursday morning, bringing strong winds and heavy rainstorms to the region. This model moon, constructed for tourists to enjoy during the Chinese Mid-Autumn holiday which celebrates the moon, apparently is no match for the awesome power of the Meranti. 

This year such life-like model moons have gone viral in China for the festival which is today, Sept. 15, with many being set up in public spaces for people to take pictures in front of it.

The recent death of a 28-year-old bridesmaid in Wenchang, south China's Hainan province, from alcohol consumption at a wedding banquet has stirred up public debate.
 
A video clip shows the woman at the wedding ceremony being egged on into drinking baijiu, a type of Chinese liquor. In the video, she loses consciousness, and is rushed to a local hospital. Unfortunately, the emergency department failed to resuscitate her.
 
An investigation by local police said the woman died after drinking excessive alcohol. She suffocated as she tried to throw up the alcohol.
 
The bridesmaid's family, with the newlyweds, are negotiating the liability and compensation of the incident.

In China, drinking is usually considered an important part of socializing, especially in business dinners and celebrations. Traditionally, the host persuades the guests to drink as much as possible, a way of showing hospitality.
 
A survey on hinews.com shows that 80% of participants say they have been coerced into drinking more than they want to at dinners. And there is now a growing number of people expressing doubts over this tradition.
 
They say that the drinking ritual goes too far, and is responsible for many unfortunate incidents such as the bridesmaid's death.
link_name: Bridesmaid dies after drinking too much liquor

status_message:
China and Russia started a joint naval drill off the coast of Guangdong Province in the South China Sea on Tuesday. The "Joint Sea 2016" drill will run until Sept. 19, featuring navy surface ships, submarines, fixed-wing aircraft, helicopters, marines and amphibious armored equipment.

Several procedures will be undertaken during the drill, including joint air defense, anti-submarine operations, landing, search and rescue, island-seizing and weapon use.
link_name: China, Russia start naval drill in South China Sea

An old bridge in eastern China suddenly collapsed Sunday morning as it was dismantled, leaving at least 5 injured and 3 missing. 

Surveillance footage shows workers and heavy machinery were on the bridge as it collapsed. 

According to the local government, three of eight workers who fell into the river remain unaccounted for. The other five who sustained injuries are being treated in hospital.

A rescue team is still searching for other possible casualties. 

An investigation is underway to the cause to the bridge's collapse.

The bridge was built in 1991 and is 848 meters long.
link_name: Bridge collapses as dismantled in east China

A car was spotted crashing into a guardrail at a toll checkpoint in Fuzhou, southeast China's Fujian Province on Wednesday morning, doing a 360 degree spin in the air before landing on the ground.
 
The driver was miraculously safe, with only minor injuries. Footage shows the driver was able to walk steadily even after such a horrible accident. 

Local police said the man was not intoxicated at the time of the car accident.
link_name: Car smashed into guardrail, driver miraculously survived

A police officer was seen carrying an 80-year-old woman in his arms and rushing through a train station in Haining, east China's Zhejiang Province on Monday. 

The cop named Song Jie was trying to help the elderly woman surnamed Liu catch her train that was about to leave the station. The woman has a problem with walking and was delayed at the checking station as she forgot to bring her ID card. 

Song took the woman to get a temporary ID first and then managed to get  Liu on the train. Well done!

The soldiers conducted the drill skillfully with the aid of modern technology and equipment.

A 63-year-old man surnamed Yang from Shenzhen was attacked by a stranger with an iron bar unexpectedly from behind while he was doing morning exercises at a local park.

A video camera shows the stranger first trying to attack Yang with an iron bar. But to his surprise, Yang snatched the bar and fought against him, beating him to the ground. Yang has been practicing Taichi kungfu for years and thus was able to defend himself.

The attacker later asked help from local police, trying to sue Yang, the victim. Due to his abnormal behaviors, police there checked the attacker and found drugs in his system. He was thus detained by the police.

The pilot of an aerobatic plane was killed in a crash during an air show on Saturday in northwest China's Gansu Province. 

The moment when the aircraft plummeted to the ground was captured by onlookers. The pilot had no time to eject. 

No one was injured on the ground.

The aircraft was taking part in the 1st Silk Road International General Aviation Convention in the city of Zhangye. 

An investigation is now underway into the cause of the crash.

Chinese diver He Zi must be the happiest girl in the world: getting a silver medal around her neck, and a diamond ring for her finger - all in one day.

How to fish with net in Bosten? It's Bosten, not Boston!

Bosten Lake is located in Bohu County in the Mongolian Autonomous Prefecture of Bayingolin, northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region. It is the largest lake in Xinjiang and one of the largest inland freshwater lakes in China. 

With flourishing reeds and wild lotus, Bosten Lake is a paradise for fish and birds. Local residents make a living by fishing, but only the residents with a license can fish in the lake. #AcrossLoulan

Traditional Costume Show in #Xinjiang

An event themed "Across Loulan – An Internet Cultural Tour Thru Xinjiang" was officially launched in Bohu County in the Mongolian Autonomous Prefecture of Bayingolin, northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region on Wednesday.

About 7 thousand local residents, most of whom are part of the Mongolian ethnic minority, participated in the opening ceremony. They wore their traditional costumes and performed a show in Bohu County. #AcrossLoulan

The games of the 31st Olympiad officially got underway with the opening ceremony at Maracana Stadium in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on Friday night. More than one billion people worldwide were expected to watch the opening ceremonies.

The three-hour gala from the iconic Maracana Stadium was a showcase for Brazil's history, culture, diversity and hopes.

207 delegations took part in Friday's festivities, including a team of refugees under the Olympic flag.
The refugee team is comprised of 10 athletes, displaced from Syria, South Sudan, Congo and Ethiopia. #Rio2016

Zhai Yanmin, an unemployed resident of Beijing, was sentenced to three years in prison with a four-year reprieve after being found guilty of subverting state power Tuesday.

Tianjin No. 2 Intermediate People's Court ordered that Zhai, 55, will have to serve a minimum three-year term should he fall foul of the law within the four-year probation period. The court also deprived Zhai of his political rights for four years.

He pled guilty and declined his right to appeal.

Zhai was first exposed to concepts such as the "color revolutions" and "peaceful transition" online, the court said in a statement. He then joined an underground church led by Hu Shigen and gradually developed plans to overthrow the state socialist system.
link_name: Illegal protest organizer given suspended sentence

status_message:
Isn't it marvelous! China's Chang'e-3 that landed on the moon in December 2013 is still working. The State Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense says it's the longest work time ever for a lunar probe. For two-and-a-half years, Chang'e 3 has collected a large amount of data and images, helping answer many important scientific questions.

The Chang'e-3 has made China's first successful soft-landing on the surface of an extraterrestrial body. Since the 1990s, China has had four missions to the moon, only second to the United States which has had five.
link_name: China's moon lander breaks working hour record

A streak of light across the night sky, coming from the remnants from a Chinese CZ-7 Rocket, reentered the atmosphere above the Western United States. 

Based on witness accounts, the light was spotted in places including Nevada, Utah and across California.

It's not a meteor shower, an alien, or a plane crash - just a rocket reentry turned into dust. (Video: Ian Norman/lonelyspeck.com)

Yaoshan ancient village is located in Libo County, southwest China's Guizhou Province. The origins of Yao people can be traced back 2,000 years ago, nowadays, their cultural relics, song and dance, clothes and customs still remain its own features. status_message:
Gates are associated with a great many things, but a Chinese gate is actually a sign of welcome……

Prince Andrew inaugurated a new traditional Chinese Gate on Monday in London's Chinatown to add his welcome to the Chinese community in the United Kingdom.

The one-million pound sterling (approx 1.3-million US dollars) gate is designed in the style of the Qing dynasty with gold leaf dragon motifs and jade imported from Beijing.

The words above the gate wish "Prosperity to the UK", while a message on the gate reads "Peace to China, Prosperity to Britain."

The Duke of York was received by a traditional Chinese lion dancer before cutting the ribbon and unveiling a plaque marking the inauguration. The plaque reads "New Chinese Gate opened by HRH The Duke of York, 25th July 2016".
link_name: Prince Andrew opens new gate in London's Chinatown

status_message:
Tragedy: A young girl was attacked, dragged away and mauled by a Siberian tiger in a wildlife park in Beijing, her mother jumped out of the car in an attempt to save her and was mauled to death by another tiger. 

CCTV footage shows the moment when the young woman stepped out of her car while touring Badaling Wildlife World. Unexpectedly, a tiger attacked her from behind and dragged her away. 

The young man and an old lady, who are reported to be the husband and the mother of the victim, immediately rushed out the car and to pursue the big cat. 

The mother later was reportedly killed by another tiger while trying to save her daughter from the mouth of the first beast. 

The daughter was luckily saved by the staff members who arrived at the scene soon after the start of the attack. The girl was rushed to hospital. She is reportedly out of danger but has suffered serious injuries. 

According to local authorities, the two women violated park regulations, which forbid tourists leaving their cars on the territory of the wildlife park. 

According to the relatives of the victims, the women mistakenly believed they had driven out of the tiger park and thought it was safe to leave their car. 

The incident is under further investigation and the zoo has temporarily been closed.
link_name: Woman mauled to death at Wildlife Park in Beijing

status_message:
9 dead; 3 gunmen at large after Munich's shootout.

Munich police warned people to avoid public places on Friday as they hunted for the shooter or shooters who opened fire at a shopping mall.

 "We're still looking for up to three perpetrators. And there are differing accounts about that. They must first be consolidated. We need to figure out, is this first hand eyewitness information, is it partial information, is it one of the rumours we were just talking about? And that's why we're working with the intention of maximising the safety of the population of Munich. So, up to three perpetrators, and that's what our activities are based on," says Marcus Da Gloria Martins, Munich police spokesman.

Stills of police officers and vehicles at scene of #Munich mall shooting. 

At least six people were killed in a shootout in the German city of Munich on Friday evening, German local media Focus Online reported.

Munich police reported on early Friday evening that they were carrying out a large-scale operation in a Munich shopping center due to a shootout.

At the moment,the police ask people to stay away from public places, because the attackers are still on the run.

"Situation around the mall is still unclear. There are several injured people," local police said on its Twitter account.

12 professors with an average age of 70 from Shaanxi Normal University are busy handwriting admission letters with traditional Chinese writing brushes.

Breaking news! 84 people were reportedly killed and many others injured as a truck rammed into crowd in Nice, southern France, local TV channels reported early Friday, citing the prosecutor of Nice.

At this stage, "we can not describe these things as an attack, but many elements suggest that," BFMTV quoted Jean-Michel Pretre as saying.

At 22:30 Thursday night local time, a truck drove at high speed into the crowd who gathered on the promenade to watch fireworks marking July 14, the French national day, wrote Christian Estrosi, president of the region of Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, on Twitter.

The driver in the incident, which was earlier reportedly described by the prefecture of the Alpes-Maritimes as an "attack", was neuralized and probe was launched to determine whether he acted alone, the interior ministry said.

French President Francois Hollande, who was in Avignon, was going back to Paris where he will directly go to the crisis unit at the Interior Ministry, according to Elysee.
link_name: Up to 84 people killed in France when truck crashes into crowd

status_message:
As a purely homegrown invention of a Chinese company, the first experimental Transit Elevated Bus (TEB) rolled off the production line on Sunday at a factory in Changzhou city, China's east Jiangsu Province.
 
The TEB has its passenger compartment sitting above other vehicles on the road below, allowing cars to pass underneath. It is designed to increase the utilization of road space. Each TEB is electric powered, replacing 40 conventional buses. It is predicted to be able to reduce urban traffic congestion by 35 percent.
 
"With a carrying capacity of 1,200 people at a time, the TEB has the same functions as the subway while its cost of construction is less than one fifth of the subway. Its construction can be finished in one year," said Bai Zhiming, the engineer in charge of the TEB project.

Trial operations of such a bus will start in Qinhuangdao City, north China's Hebei Province, in late July.
link_name: China-invented Transit Elevated Bus rolls off production line

#HelloChina- Chinese Characters

Chinese characters are some of the oldest forms of writing in the world. The earliest Chinese characters found so far are oracle bone characters that were carved on tortoise shells or animal bones over 3,400 years ago.

Chinese characters are the writing system that conveys the most diversified meanings. They are the only ideographs that are still in use. Chinese characters are just like pictures, even if you have never learned them, you can guess the meaning of many of them simply by their shapes.

It's interesting to study Chinese characters, isn't it?

#HelloChina - Panda

Meet China's national treasure, the Giant Panda, one of the oldest remaining animals on earth!

Do they like eating bamboo? Yes! They live on it. 

Do they like hot weather? No, and they also hate the cold! 

Panda's existence can be traced back three million years, while the others from the same period have all gone extinct. Chinese people called the panda "Xiong mao", literally meaning "bear cat", as it is strong as a bear, and has the cute face of a cat.

In recent years, pandas have visited many countries as China's goodwill ambassadors. More foreigners are also taking a liking to pandas because, well, they are just so irresistibly cute! 

Some call it the cutest animal on earth. Do you agree?

China's Jiangsu province has experienced hail, rain, and the worst tornado to hit in 50 years. So far 98 have reportedly been killed with 800 injured, 200 critically injured. All efforts are being made to help the area and the people there.
Sometimes you just have to work with what you have: see some videos of people using some unusual ways to travel in China. From funny to dangerous, these are all real videos caught on film.

#HelloChina – Tang Suit

The Tang suit or Tangzhuang is a Chinese jacket. The Tang suit did not originate from the Tang Dynasty.

The term actually originated from abroad. Overseas Chinese named the Chinatown as the town of people from Tang Dynasty and call themselves people from the Tang Dynasty. 

Why? Because the Tang Dynasty was the most thriving, prosperous and glorious period of ancient China.

Coined with Chinatown, western nations like to use Tang to describe subjects related to China or Chinese people.

Back in 2001 APEC summit meeting in Shanghai, China prepared Tang suits for each leader. 

The suit bears Chinese features and presents a peaceful festive presence.

Have a look and you will see the suit has four features: straight collar, sleeves and body are made from one whole piece, front-buttoned, and the buttons are frogs.
Get a bird's-eye view of the region devastated by a powerful tornado and hailstorms in east China on Thursday. So far, 98 people have been confirmed dead and some 800 wounded.

#HelloChina – Peking Duck

Peking duck, or roast duck is a famous dish in Beijing. It traces back to the imperial era of Qing dynasty. Now it also gains the popularity from all over China and aboard.

The duck used to prepare the course is of the highest quality. Its meat is fatty but not greasy. The meat is prized for its thin crisp skin, and it is sliced in front of the dinners by the cook.

Eating of the duck also has some special procedures. You put the thin duck slices into a steamed pancake, and wrap them with sweet bean sauce. You can also add some green onions or cucumber to the roll and eat it with your hand. Roasting methods are also improved in years and have higher demands on chefs' skills.

The ducks are said to be slaughtered after 65 days and seasoned before being roasted in a closed or hung oven.

status_message:
China's only coastal satellite launch center is preparing for its maiden mission. 

Wenchang Satellite Launch Center on the northeast coast of Hainan Province is expected to launch a new generation Long March-7 carrier rocket in the next few days, according to state media reports. 

Located about 60 km from the provincial capital Haikou, the center is China's only coastal launch site. Its proximity to nearby ocean ports in Wenchang facilitates the center in receiving rocket deliveries. 

The location, about 19 degrees north of the equator, is suitable for launching geosynchronous satellites, heavyweight satellites, large space station components, as well as for carrying out lunar and interplanetary missions.

The Long March-7, a medium-sized rocket using liquid propellant, can carry up to 13.5 tonnes to low Earth orbit. It will transport cargo for China's planned space station and is expected to become a main carrier for space launches.
link_name: Wenchang Satellite Launch Center to launch carrier rocket for ...
